Definition: Code indicating that the individual identifies as a member of the First Nations of Australia.

SIF.Definition: Whether or not the person identifies themselves as being of Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander descent.

OtherStandards.Definition: Identification of whether or not the user is an American Indian or Alaska Native ethnicity.
OtherStandards.Commentary: Standards devised for the US market respond to US legal categorisations of ethnicity and race, which are quite different to those applicable in Australia. This is the closest functional equivalent in One Roster, if that specification were to be used in Australia unmodified; someone or Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander descent living in the US would likelier find themselves categorised as blackOrAfricanAmerican or nativeHawaiianOrOtherPacificIslander.

Path: Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander status
OtherStandards.Definition: A student is considered to be an Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander student if they identify as being of Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander origin. The term 'origin' is considered to relate to people's Australian Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander descent and for some, but not all, their cultural identity. A student who identifies as a First Nations student is also considered to be Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander origin.

LegalDefinitions.Definition:
For the definition of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander student in section 6 of the Act, a student is an Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander student if:

  1. either or both of the following apply:
    1. the student is of Aboriginal descent;
      1. the student is of Torres Strait Islander descent; and
    2. the student identifies as a person of that descent; and
    3. the student is accepted by the community in which he or she lives as being of that descent.

Collections.Name: NAPLAN Student Registration
Collections.Commentary: Whether or not the student identifies themselves as being of Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander descent.  Refer to Data Standards Manual published by ACARA.
